page.title: 02 WIGHILL VILLAGE
page.content: Wighill is only a small country village . It has no shops not even a post office, only a pub The White Swan which is popular with the visitors from other places. All the houses line the roadside so it is a long thin village. Many of the houses are old and used to have thatched rooves. These were mainly the cottages and farms. Altogether there are sixty houses and a total population of two hundred. There are all sorts of houses from council semis, to old stone detached's. The modern houses and bungalows that have been built in the last 20 years are brick built. The church is at the end of the village sited on a hill. It has one of the best preserved Norman doorways in Yorkshire.
